module.title: Isomorphic Data Handler
module.description: Standalone module focused solely on the concept of isomorphic patterns. Handles data as recurring functional structures across scales, with concrete mappings to reveal alignments without assumptions. Schema supports optional sub-categories for compound patterns. Enhanced with evaluation methods and contradiction ledger for increased effectiveness using PSE_FPT_Geo procedure.

isomorphic_concept.definition: Isomorphic patterns are functional structures that repeat with identical causal topology across different scales, from subatomic to cosmic, allowing direct comparison and pattern detection based on observable mechanisms.
handling_rules: Map patterns to 8 scales plus a principle; entries must be concrete and observable.
Validate for complete coverage; flag gaps as incomplete.
Support sub-categories for compound patterns to maintain cleanliness.
Export as lean JSON for use in other modules; no external references.
Apply evaluation methods to validate patterns; use contradictions_ledger to track inconsistencies.

evaluation_methods.name: Completeness Validation
evaluation_methods.description: Iterate through each category and sub-category; check that all required scales have non-empty string mappings; flag incomplete entries.

evaluation_methods.name: Consistency Alignment
evaluation_methods.description: For each category, verify logical alignment between mappings and principle; flag misalignments or forced fits.

evaluation_methods.name: Isomorphism Scoring
evaluation_methods.description: Represent causal topology of each mapping as a graph; compute similarity scores (e.g., via graph edit distance) between graphs across scales; score >0.8 indicates strong isomorphism.

evaluation_methods.name: Gap Flagging
evaluation_methods.description: Identify scales with weak or absent mappings; log for refinement in contradictions_ledger.

evaluation_methods.name: Contradiction Detection
evaluation_methods.description: Scan for inconsistencies (e.g., mappings contradicting principle); catalog in ledger with source, conflict, justification, scope, and branches.

evaluation_methods.name: Fixed Point Check
evaluation_methods.description: Recursively apply evaluation methods to the module's output until no changes occur, confirming stability.

contradictions_ledger.fidelity_justification: Listings show distributed control, conflicting with 'exactly one' but reflecting real complexity.
contradictions_ledger.unresolved_scope: Complex scales where control is emergent
overgenerated_branches: B1: Revise to 'one primary control point'
B2: Branch to distributed control model

contradictions_ledger.fidelity_justification: Mappings vary in salience, potentially overgeneralizing influence.

mappings.principle: Systems require a stable inside/outside distinction to persist as coherent entities.
Every persisting entity has exactly one ultimate control point.
Energy is strictly conserved up to entropy production across all scales.
Information that can be losslessly translated across substrates.
Mechanisms for replicating patterns to ensure persistence.

mappings.technological: garbage collection + adversarial training + weight pruning
mappings.planetary: carbon cycle + extinction events + system auto-expiry
mappings.principle: Entropy must be exported outside the boundary or the entity collapses.
Neutralization of internal or external threats to maintain stability.
Offloading of disorder or unusable byproducts to prevent accumulation.
System persistence increases with accuracy of internal models of external causes.

mappings.organism: dopaminergic reward prediction error curves behaviour
mappings.planetary: default pathways made the path of least resistance
mappings.principle: System trajectories follow curvature of relevant spaces rather than direct forces.

mappings.technological: influential models openly quantizing their own weights
mappings.planetary: visible influencers demonstrating change in public
mappings.cosmic: first inflaton fluctuation that triggered the Big Bang
mappings.principle: Salient demonstration by high-status entities can restructure the system.
